dialogue_turns.speaker: Narrator
dialogue_turns.text: Trains in Kazakhstan introducing a dedicated women's carriage on the Uralsk to Mangystau route.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Trains in Kazakhstan introducing a dedicated women's carriage on the Uralsk to Mangystau route.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The national railway carrier is launching a women's carriage on route No. 614/613 Uralsk " Mangystau.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A women's carriage on route 614/613 from Uralsk to Mangystau, starting June 1st.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A women's carriage on route six hundred fourteen over six hundred thirteen from Uralsk to Mangystau, starting June first.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The national railway carrier is launching a women's carriage on route No. 614/613 Uralsk " Mangystau. According to the press service of JSC "Passenger Transportation," passengers will be able to ride in such a compartment starting from June 1.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, that's a pretty specific service. So it's only for women and female conductors, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, that's a pretty specific service. So it's only for women and female conductors, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tickets for women's carriages are sold only to women, and only female conductors work in these carriages.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. And get this—boys up to age seven are also allowed to travel with them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. And get this-boys up to age seven are also allowed to travel with them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Male passengers up to the age of seven are also allowed to travel in the 'women's compartment.'

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Huh, interesting. I guess that makes sense for mothers with young sons. But what if you're a solo male traveler? You just can't book that carriage at all?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh, interesting. I guess that makes sense for mothers with young sons. But what if you're a solo male traveler? You just can't book that carriage at all?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the tickets are sold exclusively to women. And they're reminding people to specifically ask for a women's seat at the ticket counter or look for that abbreviation online.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the tickets are sold exclusively to women. And they're reminding people to specifically ask for a women's seat at the ticket counter or look for that abbreviation online.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tickets for the women's carriage can be purchased at the station ticket offices " make sure to inform the cashier that you want a women's seat " or online at bilet.railways.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The abbreviation, um, what was it again? Something like a dash or symbol?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The abbreviation, um, what was it again? Something like a dash or symbol?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it says to look for a dash symbol meaning "women's" when booking on bilet.railways.kz.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it says to look for a dash symbol meaning women's when booking on the website.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When booking online, be sure to look for the abbreviation '–' (meaning 'women's') to indicate that the ticket is for a women's carriage," the company's press service reminded.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And this isn't the first one either—they mentioned this brings the total up to 12 routes now offering this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this isn't the first one either-they mentioned this brings the total up to twelve routes now offering this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With the addition of the new carriage, the total number of routes offering the "Women's Carriage" service will increase to 12.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, so it's clearly something they're expanding. I wonder how popular it is.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, so it's clearly something they're expanding. I wonder how popular it is.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and tickets go on sale 45 days before departure, which is pretty standard, but good to know for planning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and tickets go on sale forty five days before departure, which is pretty standard, but good to know for planning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ticket sales open 45 days before the train's departure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's an interesting approach to comfort and safety on long journeys.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's an interesting approach to comfort and safety on long journeys.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. I'd be curious to hear from women who've used these carriages, like if it really changes the travel experience.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. I'd be curious to hear from women who've used these carriages, like if it really changes the travel experience.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Maybe we'll hear some feedback once it launches next month.
